title: Out of the Curtained World
description: "I have been marked for the convent from the moment I was conceived. I imagined the vocation carved on my soul. Nothing coul dmake it wear away." At eighteen, with bright ideals and eager ex pectations, Nancy entered the convent to begin her training for a missionary life--one of the most demanding and daring forms of service to God. Gradually, Nancy began to ralize that her total dependence on her sisters to bring peace and fulfillment was sapping her mental and emotional strength instead of nourishing it. Overcoming the wrinching agony of raching the decision to leave the convent, Nancy determined that for her the only true way to deep inner peace and satisfying life of service was "Out of the Curtained World."
author: Nancy  Henderson
